intro: Syagrus duartei, commonly known as the Duarte palm, is a species of palm native to Brazil. It is characterized by its slender, tall trunk and pinnate leaves that are often used in traditional crafts. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which develop into edible fruits with a sweet, fibrous pulp. Syagrus duartei thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sun exposure. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
